ratings.comment: I loved Dr. Raasch. She is super caring and uses lots of in class examples to help illustrate her points.  She is a fair grader with a good amount of grades in the grade book. A lot of points come from in class participation worksheets that count as attendance.

Michelle is maybe my favorite professor I've ever taken.  Her class is fun, engaging and her experience and expertise are immediately apparent.  I learned so much from my time in her course and seriously cannot recommend her enough.
Easy class. Midterm and a final which she gives you a study guide for and the questions are taken right off of it.

Awesome teacher. Clear in what she expects and fair in her grading. Exams are very similar to study guides, so make sure you know everything that is on them. Do that and make sure you don't lose points on your reflections and getting an A or A/B should be a walk in the park.
Great professor! Very approachable and helpful. Gets to know students in her class. Fair in grading. Clear in presenting the information.
Michelle is an amazing teacher. She is very knowledgeable and wants you to do well. Class consisted of 2 exams, a paper, and 11 reflections. Would recommend her class to anyone and everyone!

Easiest class I've taken. She's very helpful and wants you to be involved in the class. Class consists of 2 exams (she gives study guide that says exactly what's on it), position paper, group presentation, and 5 reflections. A lot like 300.

This class was super easy! Michelle is very nice and helpful. Thought class would be about individuals with learning & behavioral disabilities, but it's really not. Very similar to RPSE 300, but still worth taking for an easy A.
